question: Which country has become the sixth largest oil supplier of India?
explanation: United States has surpassed Kuwait to become India\'s sixth-largest oil supplier. India began to import crude oil from the US in 2017 as a move to diversify India\'s import basket beyond the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) nations. Note that, currently Iraq is top supplier of crude oil for India, while Qatar is top supplier of natural gas to India.
